intro: Fimbrolina incarnata, commonly known as the pink-flowered fimbrolina, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and clusters of small, pink to white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
